poem.title: Artou/Off the Map
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text:
In the map shop the music playing was John Coltrane so far away So far away, some rag-top Rolls of a raindance raga, Indian English plosives in the tabla's Vedic commentary.
The map I took to be Tamil Nadu explained itself as Hindu Kush (as fingerprinted by the Swiss). As I looked down, to touch the names in the folds of Kashmir beaten in lines
by nimble hooves and bangled heels, Srinagar joined Schiehallion (the first hill caught in contours), Lochnagar and every trait I'd flatten out, beyond my span of days for sensing the ribcage rise, a country's cadences.
